Wagner Labor ArchiveElmer Holmes Bobst Library70 Washington Square South2nd FloorNew York, NY 10012(212) 998-2596special.collections@nyu.eduThis finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace 2021-11-12T16:41:33Finding aid written in EnglishDescribing Archives: A Content Standard Materials are in English.
Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives
Charles Fanning Collection of Audio Recordings
Fanning, Charles
Fanning, Charles
AIA.084
3.98 Gigabytes on 5 optical discs
1957-1980 Charles Fanning (1942-) is a retired professor of Irish Studies. He earned his A.B. in English literature from Harvard University (1964) and his M.A. (1968) and Ph.D. (1972) from the University of Pennsylvania. Fanning taught at Bridgewater State College for 20 years and later at Southern Illinois University at Carbondale, where he formed an Irish Studies program. The Charles Fanning Collection of Audio Recordings consists of recordings on optical discs of Irish traditional musical performances between 1957-1980. The collection includes recordings of James T. Farrell between 1957 and 1979, and performances by Eleanor Kane Neary (piano), Jimmy Neary (fiddle), Johnny McGreevy (fiddle), and Eileen Neary (vocal) at the Neary household in Chicago in 1980.
Scope and Contents
The Charles Fanning Collection of Audio Recordings consists of recordings on optical discs of Irish traditional musical performances between 1957-1980. The collection includes recordings of James T. Farrell between 1957 and 1979, and performances by Eleanor Kane Neary (piano), Jimmy Neary (fiddle), Johnny McGreevy (fiddle), and Eileen Neary (vocal) at the Neary household in Chicago in 1980.
Arrangement
The materials are arranged in the order in which they were received from the donor.
Conditions Governing Access
Materials are open without restrictions.
Conditions Governing Use
Any rights (including copyright and related rights to publicity and privacy) held by Charles Fanning were transferred to New York University in 2018 by the donor. Permission to publish or reproduce materials in this collection must be secured from repository. Please contact tamiment.wagner@nyu.edu.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Donated by Charles Fanning in August 2018; the accession number associated with this gift is 2019.121.
Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
Advance notice is required for the use of computer records. Original physical digital media is restricted. Born-digital materials have not been transferred and may not be available to researchers. Researchers may request access copies. To request that material be transferred, or if you are unsure if material has been transferred, please contact tamiment.wagner@nyu.edu with the collection name, collection number, and a description of the item(s) requested. A staff member will respond to you with further information.
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date; Charles Fanning Collection of Audio Recordings; AIA 084; box number; folder number or item identifier; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
Processing Information
At the time of processing, optical discs were inventoried, forensically imaged, analyzed, and described. New York University Libraries follow professional standards and best practices when imaging, ingesting, and processing born-digital material in order to maintain the integrity and authenticity of the content.
Biographical Note
Charles Fanning (1942- ) is a retired professor of Irish Studies. He earned his A.B. in English literature from Harvard University (1964) and his M.A. (1968) and Ph.D. (1972) from the University of Pennsylvania. Fanning taught at Bridgewater State College for 20 years and later at Southern Illinois University at Carbondale, where he formed an Irish Studies program.

Scope and Contents
The Neary Tape optical discs contains music from Eleanor Kane Neary (piano), Jimmy Neary (fiddle), Johnny McGreevy (fiddle), and Eileen Neary (vocal).James T. Farrell Recordings2.16 Gigabyteson 3 optical discs1957-1979Electronic RecordsTW_AIA_084_ER_3 - TW_AIA_084_ER_5

James T. Farrell Recordings: 1957-1979
Scope and Contents
The James T. Farrell Recordings were made between 1957 and 1979. They were organized and transcribed by Charles Fanning between March-June 2010.
